docs.snippet: Betty Finnegan made the 5 1/2-hour drive from Fort Worth, Texas, with a friend Aug. 31 to watch the last two games of the season for the Northwest Arkansas Naturals. Her 21-year-old son was finishing his first summer as a professional baseball pla...
docs.lead_paragraph: Betty Finnegan made the 5 1/2-hour drive from Fort Worth, Texas, with a friend Aug. 31 to watch the last two games of the season for the Northwest Arkansas Naturals. Her 21-year-old son was finishing his first summer as a professional baseball player on the Double-A team after helping pitch TCU into the College World Series.

headline.main: Finnegan Learns Fast: From School to World Series
headline.print_headline: Finnegan Learns Fast: From School to World Series

docs.snippet: The investigation may be complicated by conflicting accounts from witnesses and some of the freshman football players targeted by older members of the Sayreville War Memorial High School team....
docs.lead_paragraph: The investigation may be complicated by conflicting accounts from witnesses and some of the freshman football players targeted by older members of the Sayreville War Memorial High School team.
docs.abstract: New York Times investigation uncovers details of hazing scandal that led to arrest of seven varsity football players at New Jersey's Sayreville War Memorial High School; charges include allegations of sexual abuse, with prosecutors accusing three players of more serious crimes, including acts of sexual penetration; investigation was complicated by conflicting accounts and atmosphere of recrimination among students embittered by cancellation of football season.

headline.main: Football Players in Sayreville, N.J., Recall Hazing
headline.print_headline: In New Jersey, Young Players Recall Hazing

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber and Jason Grant reported from Sayreville, N.J., and Kim Barker from New York. David W. Chen and Liz Robbins contributed reporting from New York, and Joe Drape and Mary Pilon from Sayreville. Jack Begg and Susan C. Beachy contributed research from New York.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER, KIM BARKER and JASON GRANT
